p: Arturo Casadevall at the Johns Hopkins School of Public Health in Maryland says that the antibodies in the serum sop up viruses much like how a sponge sucks up a spill. He is now ramping up a four-site clinical trial to evaluate the strategy within weeks. He also envisions a coronavirus-specific plasma bank in which recovering individuals can provide antibodies to those who are still ailing, something he says could be off the ground in a few months. “One survivor can donate enough plasma to help two sick people,” he says.
